intro: Rubus swinhoei var. kawakamii, commonly known as the Kawakamii raspberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
